postdeploy.description: Post-deploy lifecycle hook will only execute if pre-deploy and function deployment completed successfully.

predeploy.description: Pre-deploy lifecycle hook - commands in the string array are sequentially executed. If any one of them fails the function will not deploy and the postdeploy lifecycle hook will not run.

rules.description: Points to the file that contains security rules for your Realtime Database.

predeploy.description: Pre-deploy lifecycle hook - commands in the string array are sequentially executed. If any one of them fails the function will not deploy and the postdeploy lifecycle hook will not run.

rules.description: Points to the file that contains Realtime Database security rules

target.description: Define a database target name to which you apply your security rules file

postdeploy.description: Post-deploy lifecycle hook will only execute if pre-deploy and function deployment completed successfully.

predeploy.description: Pre-deploy lifecycle hook - commands in the string array are sequentially executed. If any one of them fails the function will not deploy and the postdeploy lifecycle hook will not run.

rules.description: Points to the file that contains Realtime Database security rules

target.description: Define a database target name to which you apply your security rules file

database.description: Realtime Database configuration - Define either one database rules set or multiple targets each with its own unique rules file that contains the security rules for the corresponding realtime database.

emulators.description: Optional emulator configuration. Default values are used if absent.

firestore.description: Firestore configuration - define the Firestore security rules file to be deployed and also define Firestore indexes

indexes.description: Points to the file that defines indexes for Firestore

postdeploy.description: Post-deploy lifecycle hook will only execute if pre-deploy and function deployment completed successfully.

predeploy.description: Pre-deploy lifecycle hook - commands in the string array are sequentially executed. If any one of them fails the function will not deploy and the postdeploy lifecycle hook will not run.

rules.description: Points to the file that contains security rules for Firestore

predeploy.description: Pre-deploy lifecycle hook - commands in the string array are sequentially executed. If any one of them fails the function will not deploy and the postdeploy lifecycle hook will not run.

source.description: Point to the functions folder, default to "functions"

functions.description: You can define pre-deploy and post-deploy scripts in your functions configuration in firebase.json

appAssociation.description:
The default for appAssociation is AUTO.
By setting this attribute to AUTO, hosting can dynamically generate assetlinks.json and apple-app-site-association files when they're requested.

cleanUrls.description: If true, firebase will drop all .html extensions from file uploads

headers.description: An array of custom header definitions

source.description:
A glob pattern that is matched against all URL paths at the start of every request

A glob specifying a rewrite rule

Matched against the original request path, regardless of rewrite rules

ignore.description: Specifies files to ignore on deploy

target.description:
Deploy targets are short-name identifiers (that you define yourself) for Firebase resources in your Firebase project, like a Hosting site with unique static assets or a group of Realtime Database instances that share the same security rules.
See: https://firebase.google.com/docs/cli/targets

To create a deploy target and apply a target-name to a Hosting site, run the following CLI command:
firebase target:apply type target-name resource-name

trailingSlash.description: Controls whether URLs should have trailing slashes or not

By setting this attribute to AUTO, hosting can dynamically generate assetlinks.json and apple-app-site-association files when they're requested.

rules.description: Points to the file that contains security rules for storage buckets

target.description: Define a resource target to which you apply your storage security rules file

postdeploy.description: Post-deploy lifecycle hook will only execute if pre-deploy and function deployment completed successfully.

predeploy.description: Pre-deploy lifecycle hook - commands in the string array are sequentially executed. If any one of them fails the function will not deploy and the postdeploy lifecycle hook will not run.

storage.description: Either define shared security rules which will apply to all of your storage buckets or define multiple targets each with its own unique file that contains the security rules for the corresponding storage bucket.
